inn1.comm: length ball, a bit of swing to straighten towards off stump, and Kusal defends off the back foot

looks to go fuller, perhaps aiming for the blockhole delivery on middle stump, but he can't control his swing and it goes down the leg side, and Perera gets a bit of pad on it down to the fine leg boundary
back of a length on middle and off, comes in a touch to cramp him for room, and he defends off the back foot
good ball, swinging in from off to middle on a good length, and he gets forward to punch it back to the bowler, who dives to his right to stop that in his follow-through
fullish length again, swings in towards middle and off, and Perera punches it back to the bowler, his bat turning a little in his hands

appeal for lbw, and the umpire's given it! This was always on the cards with the amount of swing Yadav was getting. Pitched on leg and straightened, and hit him low on the front pad as he looked to work it into the leg side, head falling over a touch. Good decision from the umpire. That pitched well in line with leg and would have taken a decent chunk of leg stump.
angled in from wide of the crease, and he overdoes it. Saha does brilliantly to dive full length to his left and take that with one glove
length ball, angling in towards off stump, worked towards midwicket
steep inward angle again, back of a length, and Dilshan can't quite connect with that clip and is hit high on the pad, on his toes, and the ball runs away towards square leg
lovely delivery. This was on a good length outside off, drew Dilshan forward, and straightened past his outside edge as he pushed his bat out, playing for the angle
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away to third man
length ball, angling towards off stump. Sanga defends from the crease, nice and compact
full outswinger, gives Dilshan a bit of width and doesn't he love width? He simply flat-bats it away to the right of cover
short now, a tiny bit of width outside off and that's a rasping square cut. Gets on top of the bounce and easily beats third man running to his right
full outside off, not quite a half-volley, and lots of outswing to beat Dilshan's swishing blade
back of a length on middle and leg, no swing this time, and he tucks it away to deep backward square leg
length ball, slanting across Sangakkara, and he opens his bat face to steer that to backward point
a little straighter now and he shuffles across and lets it come on, tucks it away to deep backward square leg
back of a length on leg, angling towards middle, and he looks to work it leg side and gets a leading edge that pops into the off side
length ball, slanting away from an off-stump line, left alone. Good carry through to Saha

back of a length, angling towards off stump, and Sangakkara looks for the dabbed single towards square leg, but Dilshan sends him back, and rightly so, because Jadeja was quick as a flash to move to his left from short midwicket
length ball angling towards off stump, and this time they take the quick single, pushed towards mid-off with soft hands
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended towards short midwicket. Ishant falls over in his follow-through and gets up with a grin
length ball, a bit of width outside off, and Dilshan can't beat point with his slash
length ball on off stump, clipped towards mid-on
slanted across, a little bit of width outside off and he slaps it away to the left of Ishant at third man
a little fuller outside off, and he comes forward to punch it to cover
a touch shorter now and he steers it away to the man at point
short, down the leg side, and Sanga can't connect with the pull

slower ball on off stump. Sanga waited for it on the front foot and pushed it with soft hands to Kohli at mid-off, and set off for the quick one. Kohli swooped down quickly on the ball, but took his eye off it and failed to pick it up as he shaped to throw
a bit of outswing outside off from just back of a length. Dilshan waves his bat at it away from his body, and doesn't connect
bouncer now, rises over leg stump as Sanga withdraws from the pull that he initially shaped to play
back of a length on middle stump, worked away towards square leg
length ball on off stump, defended off the back foot to short midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, defended back to the bowler, who falls over in his follow-through yet again
bouncer, looked like it was slightly down the leg side, but the umpire doesn't call it wide
fuller, on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
gets his line wrong, and Sanga flicks it off his hips to deep backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, not quite short enough to pull, rolls down to midwicket
length ball outside off, a bit of away swing, and he opens his face to steer that to point
length ball on off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump, cramps him for room, and he works it away to short midwicket
full on off, a bit of outswing, and he drives it into the covers
length ball angling in towards off. He comes forward and dabs it away to backward point
comes forward looking to drive on the up through cover, without quite taking the inward angle into account. Hits the inside half of his bat and runs into the on side
back of a length, a tiny bit of width, slapped down to third man
back of a length, too straight, clipped off the hip down to deep backward square leg
length ball outside off. Dilshan is too early into that drive and he drags it to mid-off
short, just a bit of width, but that's enough for Dilshan. Gets on top of the bounce and cuts it hard through the gap between point and third man
slower ball outside off, quite full, beats Sanga who goes for the big drive
back of a length outside off, punched to extra cover

spears it in full and pings him on the front pad, but it looked like the angle would take it down the leg side. Sanga seemed surprised by the length and his head was falling over as he tried to work it leg side
bouncer to follow up. Sanga is hurried into the hook, and he top-edges it, one bounce and over the fine leg boundary
full outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length on off stump. It straightens a touch and Sangakkara gets an outside edge down to third man as he looks to push through the covers
tossed up outside off, pushed into the covers for the quick single
down the track, and he hits uppishly, but into the gap to the left of cover, and picks up another boundary
down the track again, and this time he goes straighter, back over the bowler's head. Got to the pitch of this, staying leg-side of the ball, and swung his arms through the line
and another. Again he leaves his crease. It's a carrom-ball, but he's close enough to the pitch for that to not matter too much, and he smacks it back over the bowler's head
wow. This isn't really a bad ball, on off and middle on a decent length, but he quickly gets down on one knee and sweeps that away between square leg and short fine leg
full on middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket
length ball on off stump, stays back and dabs it to backward point
down the track now, clipped through square leg
bowled him! It's back of a length and he quickly rocks back to cut. Not much turn on that and it sneaks past his inside edge and crashes into middle and off
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended off the front foot
a bit of air on this, angled in towards off, and he gets forward to block it back to the bowler
back of a length, goes with the arm towards off stump but Mahela stays low and leg-side of the ball as he goes on the back foot and steers it away towards short third man
tossed up on middle and off, pushed towards short midwicket with a straight bat
length ball, goes with the angle towards off stump, goes back and punches back to the bowler
fuller, slightly wider outside off and he comes forward to push that to short cover
full on middle stump, driven down to long-off
tossed up outside off, defended into the covers
goes for the sweep from outside off, hits it slightly uppishly down to deep backward square leg
length ball outside off, comes forward, lets it come on, and drives to sweeper cover
slants this across, and Sanga leans back to cut towards deep point
angles this in towards leg stump and MJ comes forward, tries to work it leg side, and is hit on the front pad
a bit flatter, just outside off, blocked into the off side
length ball outside off, comes forward and dabs it to the left of short cover and calls Sanga through for a quick single. Sanga dives into the crease
length ball outside off, he comes forward and drives with a straight bat to long-on
tossed up and he's quickly down the track to drive to long-off
angles this towards leg stump and he clips it away to deep backward square leg
flat on middle stump, tucked away to square leg
back of a length, goes with the angle towards off stump, and he goes back and punches it to long-off
oh, my. That was full on middle stump, and Mahela could have flicked it anywhere he wanted, but he hit it uppishly, and down the throat of Rayudu at deep midwicket
goes on the back foot as he angles this towards middle and leg, and pushes it with a straight bat to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched towards short midwicket off the back foot
this one's a bit slower through the air and he sweeps it down to deep backward square leg
flat length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot
tossed up a bit higher and he drives it down to long-off
flat and full on off stump, blocked into the covers
length ball, angled across towards off stump, gets forward and punches back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, doesn't turn in, and he gets back and across to defend
a little quicker, on middle stump, and it's clipped to square leg
a bit fuller, slower through the air, and he drives it down the ground to long-on, between the diving bowler and short midwicket fielder
tossed up on off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
tossed up again, outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, clipped down to long-on
a bit of flight, angled in towards off, and Mathews defends back to the bowler
back of a length now, and he steers it down to deep point
full on off stump, blocked off the front foot back to the bowler
flat, angled in towards middle stump, clipped to short midwicket
down the leg side now, and he turns his wrists to work it to short fine leg
length ball, goes with the angle towards off stump, and he punches it back to the bowler off the back foot
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
pitched up on off and middle, and he clips it to short midwicket
a touch shorter now and he goes on the back foot to work it towards square leg
flat and full on off, and he clips it down to long-on
angled in towards off stump, fairly full, defended back to the bowler
back of a length now, goes back and punches towards deep point
down the leg side now and Sangakkara gets down low to sweep, very fine and well out of range of deep backward square leg
back of a length, angled across towards off stump, slapped away towards sweeper cover
tosses this up and he comes down the track and whips it to mid-on. Had to hurry through the single. Umesh misses the stumps with his throw, but Mathews would have been home safe anyway
looks to sweep again, misses, and is hit on the pad, runs away fine on the leg side. Pitched outside leg
full and flat on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, goes on the back foot to punch to long-off
boom. Saw a bit of flight outside off and quickly got on one knee to slog-sweep that over the deep square leg boundary
a little flatter outside off, defends off the front foot towards mid-on
fuller, straighter, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, goes with the arm, and he punches it back towards the bowler
tossed up on off stump, clipped off the front foot to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, he goes back and across and works it to long-on
down the track now, and he swipes this cleanly over midwicket, down to the wide long-on boundary
flatter now, on off stump, and Mathews defends off the front foot
fullish on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, slapped to deep point
full, angling in towards leg stump, nurdled around the corner towards deep square leg
short, a bit of width, cut away to deep point
length ball outside off, driven to short cover, where Kohli makes a diving stop but the ball runs away towards mid-off
full, angled down the leg side, clipped to deep backward square leg
tossed up wide outside off, he reaches out and flat-bats it between point and cover
stays back to a length ball outside off, dabs it away towards point
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to long-on
flat and quick outside off, and Sanga gets forward to dab it towards point
back of a length on middle stump. Sanga shuffles across to tuck it off his hips down to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover
a touch too straight and it's clipped off the pads to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, and Dhawan does well at mid-off to tumble to his left and stop that well-timed punch
back of a length on leg stump, shuffles across to flick it away off his hips, to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, prodded into the gap to the right of the man at point
full on middle stump, clipped down to long-on
a bit slower outside off, and Sanga gets forward to drive it to long-off
angled in towards middle, fairly full, clipped to short midwicket
flat and full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
nice length on off stump, straightened just a touch, blocked back to the bowler
full on off stump, clipped to short midwicket
flat on middle stump, not much turn. He makes room and pushes it into the covers off the back foot
tossed up outside off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
looked to steer that away off the back foot and Raina dived to his right from backward point to make an athletic stop
full on leg stump, Mathews plays a checked drive to long-on
pitched up on leg stump. Sanga gets forward and uses his wrists to flick it away towards deep square leg
angled in towards off stump, not much turn, defended with a straight bat to short midwicket
tossed up on off stump, swept down to deep square leg
loopy delivery on off stump, driven down to long-off
too full to sweep from off stump, and he gets a bottom edge that rolls down to short midwicket
down the pitch now, converts it into a full toss and chips it over midwicket. Excellent work from Ishant to sprint to his left from long-on and dive to his left to stop it at the boundary
swept from outside off down to deep backward square leg
down the track as Jadeja tosses this up, and is hit on the pad as he tries to work it across the line from outside off
full on middle stump, pushed to short midwicket with a straight bat
a bit slower and he's too quick through that attempt to work it leg side. Hit on the front pad, and not much of an appeal. That pitched outside leg
length ball on middle and leg, worked to short midwicket
tossed up outside off, Sanga comes forward and opens his face to steer that towards deep point
sees him come down the track and bowls it quicker and flatter, wide outside off, and he reaches across and pokes it towards point
back of a length on off stump, not much room to work with, and he punches it to cover
tossed up outside off, uses his wrists to try and whip that to long-on but the bowler gets in the way
beaten. Sanga goes for the sweep from outside off but it's too quick for him
full, almost in the blockhole outside off, pushed back to the bowler
and that's Sanga's fifty. Clears his front leg as Jadeja bowls this full and flat on middle, and heaves it over midwicket, to the left of long-on
looks to lap it from wide outside off, only manages to get front pad on it
in the blockhole on off stump, dug out towards straight midwicket
tossed up outside off, blocked with the turn towards short midwicket
reverse-sweep now. Saw the line outside off, and used his wrists to place that very fine, to the left of the short third man fielder
full outside off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
tossed up very slow outside off. He goes back and tucks it away towards short midwicket
looks for the reverse-sweep again. It's slower and not as full and he inside-edges it onto his pad
back of a length now and he goes deep in his crease and works it with the turn towards deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, and he goes back and pokes it away towards short cover
quickish on off. He was looking to make room to go over cover but it's too quick for that and he defends into the off side
now he looks to fire it fuller and ends up slanting down the leg side
a bit wider outside off and he opens his bat face to steer it towards backward point
full on leg stump and he uses his wrists to shovel that away over midwicket
a bit slower outside off and he lets it come on and steers it to short third man. Sends Mathews back, even though it was the non-striker's call
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn to long-on
full on off stump and he clears his front leg to swipe it away to the left of long-on
bad ball, full down the leg side, and he glances it away very fine, pivoting on his toes
back of a length outside off, punched to cover, who's standing on the edge of the circle
down the track now, doesn't really get to the pitch, but he manages to flat-bat it away over extra cover
in the blockhole outside off. Mathews goes hard at the drive and inside-edges into his pads, bounces towards short third man
angles this down leg and he flicks it in the air but it drops down well in front of the man at deep backward square leg
length ball on middle stump, clipped towards deep midwicket
length ball spinning in towards the off stump, eased down the ground for a single
from round the wicket, short of length and turning away, bottom edge as he plays that one
pushed towards extra cover for a single this time
spinning away, the carrom ball, guided towards backward point
length ball from round the wicket, pushed towards long-on for a risk-free single
full from round the wicket, squeezed out towards cover

oh! what have you done Kumar Sangakkara, that was a full toss, Sangakkara could have dispatched it where he liked, he can only hit it to long-on, where Shikhar Dhawan takes an overhead catch, umpires want to check whether that was above waist high, it wasn't, Umesh gets a big wicket with a boundary-ball
short of length ball just outside off, defended down the track
pitched up and down the leg side, Prasanna looks to swipe that behind square leg, he can't get bat on it
shorter and outside off, guided down to third man for a single
guided towards backward point where a diving stop from Ajinkya Rahane completes a super over for India, in the Powerplay too
drags this short, batsman charges down the track, worked towards midwicket
another dot ball, slides this one down the leg side, swept but straight to short fine leg
and again Jadeja fires it towards the pads, Prasanna goes for the sweep, misses
shorter from Jadeja, tucked towards square leg, four dots in a row
this time he makes good contact with the sweep, not good enough to clear the rope or reach the fielder in the deep, this lands short of the deep fielder
lovely shot from Mathews to bring up his half-century, a lofted inside-out drive over covers for four, that was great to watch, still only five off the over
starts with a short ball outside off, Prasanna goes for the hook, meets only air, the ball flies through to the keeper

this time he connects, and connects superbly, the short ball is clobbered over deep backward square leg for six, this time the short ball from Ishant was closer to the body, the previous one was just outside off, that shot will provide a big confidence boost for Prasanna
pitched up this time, angling in towards off stump, bottom hand comes off the bat as Prasanna looks to clip that to the leg side
goes for a flat-batted slog to a back of a length delivery, badly timed, the ball rolls past mid-on

once more Mathews skips down the track, he's nowhere near the pitch of this ball but Mathews goes through with his shot, backing away from the stumps as he plays that, makes good contact and that is struck cleanly through the covers for four, Mathews looking in great touch here
backing away from the stumps as the ball is fired down the leg side, off the pads to the left of the keeper for a leg-bye
short of length ball outside off, defended towards extra cover for a single
fired towards the pads, swept away behind square leg for four

again on the pads, again the sweep, this time it is hit straight to the man at deep backward square leg, easy enough catch that for Ambati Rayudu, nice height, not too far to go but he did have the sun in his eyes
length ball is whipped towards deep square leg after the batsman skips down the track

length ball is worked towards deep midwicket, they want to race back for the second, Rayudu races in from the rope, onto the ball quickly, he fires in the return, to Jadeja who breaks the stumps with Priyanjan nowhere near making it, for that second run to be available, the fielder had to make a mistake, he didn't, and Sri Lanka lose another
short of length ball from Ishant, clipped off the thigh pad for a single
pitched up and outside off, pushed towards mid-on by Mathews, he'll have to stay till the end if Sri Lanka are to post a big score

length ball is played with soft hands towards mid-on, Mathews wanted one, he sets off, Perera is not interested, he is looking at the ball, Mathews has to turn back, he has plenty of time to get back though

slower, full ball is turned towards midwicket, this time there is no run, Mathews knows it, he doesn't budge, Perera on the other hand starts sprinting, the ball has gone straight at the fielder, Perera dives back
low full toss is thumped towards long-on, no doubt about there being a single in that
back of a length ball outside off, guided behind square leg
spinning away just a bit after pitching on off stump, defended towards cover
whipped towards midwicket this time, finds the fielder
full and outside off, pushed towards cover, Jadeja getting through this over quickly
eased towards long-on for a single this time
length ball on the pads, tucked towards square leg for one more
length ball heading towards the pads, defended to the leg side, good over that from Jadeja
angled in towards middle and leg and he shuffles across to work it to deep backward square leg
tossed up wide outside off, a bit of drift away as well, and he's beaten trying to squeeze it through point
tossed up again, a little closer to off, and he whips it down to long-on
nice flight outside off, angling in from wide of the crease, and he blocks it off the front foot
back of a length on off, punched off the back foot to short midwicket
slower now, fuller, angling in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full outside off, and he manufactures a sweep and executes it well, hitting it firmly to the left of the man at short fine leg
goes for the sweep again, hits it in the air this time, much squarer, and it bounces once before crossing the square leg boundary. Lovely swivel of the hips to get the power
not quite as full, and he uses the inward angle from wide of the crease to sweep it once again, to the left of Ashwin at short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, punched to deep point
tossed up wide outside off. Perera says thank you for the room, and frees his arms to launch that powerfully, high over the bowler's head
angled in towards off and middle, and he nurdles it away to deep square leg
yorker on off stump, and he jams his bat down to keep it out
bowled him! He spears this in full and straight again, not quite yorker length, and Perera slogs across the line, misses, and it runs off his pad into the stumps
length ball angling in towards off, and he comes forward to defend into the off side
this one's a touch wider and he looks to dab it into the covers for a single, hits it too close to the cover fielder
a bit of width this time and he slaps it firmly but Jadeja dives to his left at cover to stop it
length ball, angling in towards off, and Randiv blocks it back to the bowler. Akshar has a wicket maiden, well bowled!
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
tossed up a little slower outside off, and he can't get that drive past the bowler

down the track now, doesn't quite reach the pitch, but he still manages to whip it away, against the turn, over midwicket. Umesh does very well to sprint around from long-on, tumble to his right, and pull it back just short of the rope
big appeal for lbw as he comes forward to sweep and is hit on the front foot, on the full. Not given, and it's a very good decision. It hit the back of the bat and then the foot
down the track now, driven to long-on
fired in flat towards off stump, and he comes forward to dab it towards short cover
down the track, yorks himself, jams his bat down to squirt it towards square leg
down the track now, and he gets too close to the pitch, drags it back towards the bowler
mid-on was in the circle and he went over his head, and just about cleared him despite not getting to the pitch and mistiming it

length ball, angling in towards off stump, and he backs away trying to carve it through the covers, gets a thick outside edge that runs away to the left of short third man. Ashwin can only escort it to the rope
clears his front leg now as Akshar angles it in, quite full, and swipes it out towards deep midwicket
tossed up outside off and Randiv plays a checked drive to sweeper cover
looks to reverse-sweep a full ball on off stump, is too early on it and it rolls off his glove towards the keeper

bowled him. Randiv looked to make room and hit him over cover, and Ashwin had bowled it a lot slower and given it more air. He's too early into his shot and the ball drops on him and turns in to hit off stump
tossed up on off stump and he presses forward to defend
nice loop again, enticing the big shot, but Prasad is content to defend it
back of a length on off stump, carrom ball, and he goes back and across to poke it away towards slip
another carrom ball, it's fuller and on middle stump, and he plays with the full face of the bat to defend with the turn towards cover
in the blockhole on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, he gets back and across to defend back to the bowler
short ball, fended away towards square leg
that's full and fast, aiming for the leg-stump yorker, gets it slightly wrong and it's down the leg side
down the track, makes a lot of room to the full ball on leg stump, and pokes it away towards deep cover
full and wide and he stands up tall and swishes his bat through the line to drill that through the covers, to the left of short extra cover
short ball now, angling in. He shuffles a long way across and can't connect with the clip off the hips
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed away towards short midwicket
yorker outside off, driven down to long-off
that was a length ball wide outside off and he stands up tall and punches it over the top of cover. Really good-looking shot, that. He always looks like a top-order batsman.
back of a length on off, and he makes a bit of room and dabs it down to third man
in the blockhole on leg stump, and he makes a lot of room to push that down to long-off

very full, but he gives him a bit of width outside off, and he frees his arms to steer that to the right of third man. Umesh slides to his right and pulls it back from the rope. It bounced off his thigh, but it was away from him by the time his body slid over the rope
back of a length, angling across, and he opens his bat face to dab it down to third man
looks for the leg stump yorker, slides it marginally down the leg side
off-stump yorker, dug out towards point
full down leg. Mathews misses the flick, and gets a lot of pad on it down to deep backward square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away to deep backward square leg
nicely bowled. It's the slower ball, angling across Dhammika, and he's frozen to his spot, unbalanced, and he unsuccessfully pokes at it outside off
another slower ball, a little straighter, and he shuffles across to prod it into the on side, rolls down to long-on
down the track, he makes some room and Umesh follows him. Flicked down to deep square leg
off-stump yorker, jabbed down to long-off

bouncer now, angled across Dhammika, who stands rooted to his spot and lets it pass him. It was a little too far from him to play a shot but the umpire doesn't signal wide, just taps his shoulder to say one for the over
in the blockhole on leg stump and he clips it away to deep square leg

full, angled across Prasad, who looks to flick it from wide outside off. Goes high in the air but drops down between deep backward square leg running to his left and midwicket running back towards the rope
bounces him again, and Prasad ducks under it
another short ball, rising towards the rib-cage, and it hits his body as he attempts to fend at it awkwardly, and it bounces down to the left of the keeper
just misses leg stump with the yorker, as Prasad lifts his foot out of the way. Really harsh call of wide, I thought
another yorker, outside off this time, and he shuffles across to work it towards midwicket
low full-toss on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, and he tucks it off his hips towards square leg
down the track, makes a lot of room and Umesh follows him, spearing it towards his feet, and he drags it down to long-on
short ball, good change-up, and Dhammika was in no position to do anything but duck under it
back of a length, only slightly off line and that too because Dhammika walked across his stumps. He tickled it neatly off his hips, very fine, and it ran away to the fine leg boundary
follows Mathews as he backs away outside leg, spears in the yorker, and he clips it away towards square leg
and again. Looks for the yorker and ends up bowling a low full-toss on off stump. He goes back and across and flicks it past the square leg fielder
another full-toss on the pads, clipped to the left of the square leg fielder
yorker on off stump, driven down to long-on, and Ishant has overstepped
shuffles across and he follows him with the bouncer. Prasad can do nothing about it, just duck his head out of the way and lift his gloves up as a means of self-defence
shortish on middle stump. Dhammika stays next to the line of the ball and dabs it away towards short third man
full-toss to finish, and Mathews finally gets a boundary away, swatting it away wide of long-on

inn2.comm: a bit of inward movement from outside off and a muted lbw shout as Rahane is hit high on the back thigh, looking to shuffle across and defend
back of a length again, a bit more width this time, and he stands tall and punches it away to the left of a diving short cover fielder
fuller now and he gets a nice stride in to defend to mid-off
back of a length once more, comes in off the seam and he punches it to mid-off with a high left elbow
shortish ball, a bit of width, but this time his punch is too close to the cover point fielder, who still has to fall to his left to stop that.
lovely delivery, full and lots of inswing towards off stump. Rahane threatens to fall over but manages to bring his bat down in front of his pad and defend with a straight bat
shortish slower ball, comes in towards the stumps from outside leg, and Dhawan can't get any bat on it as he tries to whip it away. Trickles to the keeper off his thigh pad
full, angled across towards off, and he comes forward and steers it to backward point. A bit of swing away from Dhawan as well
fullish on a tight middle stump line, blocked back to the bowler
length ball angling towards off. He looks to push it to mid-on for the single but makes too firm a connection
lovely delivery, slanting across Dhawan and moving further away. His front foot only makes a tiny movement forward, and he's beaten pushing at the ball in front of his body
back of a length, angling towards leg stump from just outside. Dhawan misses the flick and it hits his back thigh
back of a length, angling in towards middle, and he gets on his toes and tucks it away to short fine leg
length ball, shapes in a touch towards the pads and he clips it away towards deep square leg
full on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
fullish, slanting across outside off, and he gets forward to defend into the covers
back of a length on off stump, punched to the left of cover
back of a length, a bit of width outside off. Rahane looks to cut but it keeps a little low and he chops it down towards slip
back of a length on off and he defends off the back foot into the covers
length ball on leg stump, nudged away into the gap between short midwicket and mid-on
length ball outside off, punched to point after a half-stride forward
shortish outside off. Goes for the cut but he's through his shot a little too quickly and the ball beats his bat
good ball, this, comes in towards off and Rahane defends cautiously back to the bowler
back of a length, a bit of width outside off, punched to the man at point
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and dabs it down to third man

back of a length on off stump, and he shuffles across and works it to short fine leg. They take off for the single and the throw misses the stumps, luckily for Dhawan. He was out if that hit. Gamage was the fielder.
angled in towards off stump, fairly full. Dhawan plays on the back foot and pushes it into the covers
back of a length, a bit of width outside off, slapped to third man
full outside off, pushed to mid-off off the front foot and he calls Dhawan through for the single immediately. Judged the weight of that shot very well
back of a length outside off, punched to cover
length ball on off stump. Rahane takes a step forward and across and flicks it towards deep square leg
fullish on off stump, and he gets a lot of wrist into that whip towards deep midwicket
length ball, angling away from off. He shuffles across a long way and bunts it down into the leg side, in front of mid-on
full outside off, gets forward to drive but it doesn't quite come on and he pokes it back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump. Rahane steps across his crease to defend
back of a length on off stump, punched towards point
length ball on off stump, pushed down to mid-off with no real footwork
back of a length on middle stump, pushed down to mid-on

got him, and what a catch that is from Mahela! Rahane throws his bat at a full ball outside off, and it swings away just a touch and takes his outside edge. It bounces off Sangakkara's gloves, and Jayawardene reacts instantly at slip to dive to his left and pluck it with his left-hand
length ball outside off, Rayudu leaves it alone
in that channel outside off once more and Rayudu leaves again
back of a length outside off and that's a good-looking shot from Rayudu, stands up tall and punches between point and cover

massive reprieve for Dhawan. It's on the perfect length, slanting away from off stump. Dhawan pokes at it with no footwork and the ball slides past his outside edge into Sanga's gloves. He appeals frantically, and it's not given, and you can see why Sanga thought that was out. Pretty solid edge on that.
back of a length on middle and he defends back to the bowler
looks for the bouncer, bowls it down the leg side
back of a length wide of off, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched to point
short outside off, pulled away towards deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched towards point
back of a length outside off, angling in, and he lets it go. It isn't too wide outside off
back of a length on off stump, defended towards short cover
short outside off, left alone. Umpire signals one bouncer for the over
back of a length outside off, Rayudu leaves it alone
back of a length just outside off, and he gets back and across and punches it sweetly to the cover boundary
full, a bit of width, driven to the left of cover. Bat made a lovely sound as it made contact with the ball
down the leg side now and the umpire signals wide
length ball outside off, and that's well played. Came forward and pushed it to the right of the man at short cover and immediately called Dhawan through for the single
full outside off, another quick single after Dhawan plays a checked drive to the right of mid-off
length ball, angles down leg again and he gets a bit of pad on it to the left of the keeper after he missed the flick
back of a length, angling towards off, and he lets it come on and works it away wide of mid-on
full on leg stump, clipped down to deep backward square leg
shortish ball angling in. He rides the bounce and bunts it down into the on side for a quick single
back of a length on middle stump, and he swivels with his hips to whip that down to deep square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended towards mid-off
short, not too wide outside off. Rayudu gets on the hop to get on top of the bounce, and steers it down to third man
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot towards short cover
full on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, pushed down to mid-off looking for the quick single
short, wide, cracked away to deep point
back of a length outside off, punched towards short cover
length ball outside off, left alone
fuller now and he comes forward to drive to the left of mid-off, doesn't quite time it
on the pads now and he clips it to the man at a straightish midwicket
slanted in from wide of the crease, and he can't quite connect on the flick, is hit on the pad
down the track, driven to long-off

tossed up outside off, Rayudu leaves it alone. Whoa, hang on, what happened there? The umpire's gone to the third umpire to refer a stumping. Why exactly, I wonder. Sanga whips the bails off enthusiastically, but Rayudu never lifted his foot.
back of a length outside off. Rayudu looks to work it leg side and edges it into his pads
back of a length outside off, goes back and across to defend
tossed up outside off, he lets it come to him and defends with soft hands
angled across on a good length, and Dhawan comes forward to steer it to deep point
back of a length on off stump, dabbed down to third man
fullish outside off, times that drive well but hits it straight to short cover
length ball on off stump, steered to point
back of a length on middle, and he comes down the track, makes some room and.... punches it straight to point. He's struggling to hit the gaps today
length ball on off stump and Dhawan says enpogh is enough. Clears his front leg and swats across the line to hit it over midwicket. His first boundary today
tossed up outside off. He stays back and punches it to short cover
down the track now, pushes it down to long-on for the strolled single
down the track, clipped away against the turn to the right of deep square leg
tossed up on off stump, defended into the off side
goes back to a length ball on off stump and works it with the turn, to the right of short midwicket, for the single that brings up India's 50
slants this down the leg side and Dhawan works it away to deep square leg
tosses it up wide outside off and he drives it to sweeper cover
down the track, punched to the right of the bowler, who goes across quickly to field it and then gives away an overthrow trying to catch Dhawan outside his crease with a backhand flick
down the track now, driven down to long-off
down the track, pushed back to the bowler as he shifts his line straighter to deny him room to free his arms
down the track again, clipped down to long-on from outside off
now Dhawan is out of his crease, whips it from outside off to the left of long-on
tossed up nice and slow outside off, and Dhawan waits for it and dabs it away towards point
down the track, driven past the diving bowler to long-on
angled in towards off stump, and he comes forward to block it into the off side
tossed up high, wide of off stump, and he drives it hard but short cover gets a hand on it to slow it down

down the track, and that's massive. He gets into the perfect position, inside the line with a lot of room to free his arms. And he goes through a full, smooth follow-through and lands that well over the long-on boundary
quicker, outside off, dabbed towards point off the front foot
length ball on middle stump, he goes on the back foot to work it leg side but it's too full for that and he hits it a few feet to the left of the bowler
tossed up outside off and he chips it over extra cover to pick up two
down the track and he bowls it quicker. Dhawan pushes it down the ground but Dilshan is like lightning, dives to his right to save the single
down the track again, whipped away wide of long-on to bring up the 50 partnership
tossed up outside off, a bit of turn in, and he punches it to the man at mid-off
flat on middle stump. He stays back and pushes it down to long-on
length ball outside off. He lets it come on and opens his bat face to dab it to the right of the man at short third man
down the track, Randiv shortens his length a touch, and he tucks it off his pad towards midwicket
length ball on off stump, and he lets it come to him and pushes it into the covers
down the track, Randiv pulls his length back a touch, and Rayudu blocks it back to the bowler
straighter now and he goes back to work it to short midwicket
down the track, doesn't quite reach the pitch, punches it back to the bowler
slanted across Dhawan outside off, and he dabs it towards point with an open face
and there's the reverse-sweep. It's full on middle stump and he moves his bat into line and just lets it run off the face, very fine
down the track now and smacks it back over the bowler's head, rolls down to the long-off boundary
that's not short, and it's turning in towards off, but he jumps back, makes himself room, and cuts that down towards deep backward point. Lovely shot
down the track once more, driven firmly to the right of extra cover
full-toss on middle stump and he simply clears his front leg and swats that over midwicket, to the wide long-on boundary
fullish outside off, driven to sweeper cover
short now, angling down leg, and he helps it along down towards long leg
full outside off, driven to mid-off
short, and that's a crisply struck pull. Stands up tall and swivels around to find the square leg boundary and bring up his half-century
length ball angling away outside off, slapped to backward point
yorker on leg stump and he nearly falls over as he plays it but clips it away fairly well towards deep square leg
down the track now, and he makes full use of the room afforded by the angle across him, swinging his arms through the line and launching it cleanly over the long-off boundary
shuffles across his stumps now, and just helps the short ball along, from outside off down to the square leg boundary. Simply turned his bat face on that and swivelled at the hip
oho, this is spectacular batting. It's short, with just a bit of width on it, and he gets right next to the ball, lets it almost pas him, and then ramps it down to the third man boundary, very fine
the angle in cramps some of his room now, and he leans back and dabs it down to third man
another short ball, and now Rayudu tries the ramp shot. He's late on it and doesn't connect
slower ball on leg stump, clipped down to short fine leg and they complete the single much easier than they should have. The fielder was on his heels a little
full on off stump, punched to mid-off
down the track now, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, punches it back to the bowler
full, a bit of width, and Randiv does well to dive to his right and stop that firmly struck drive
full outside off, and he comes down the track and gets a thick bottom edge on it, bounces up and flies away wide of Sangakkara
length ball on middle and off, defended to short cover
low full-toss outside off, pushed to mid-off for the quick single
full on off stump, jabbed away past point
down the track now, clipped to short midwicket

down the track again, and that is another stunning shot. He takes it from off stump and flicks it in the air, and even though deep square leg didn't have that much ground to cover to his right, it was past him like a flash
length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler
down the pitch again, whipped from outside off to long-on. Not too much turn here for Priyanjan
fullish on off, punched back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, slapped to third man
full outside off, and that's a pretty well-timed push into the off side but the fielder at short cover denies him by throwing himself full length to his left. Randiv, I think.
full, angling in towards middle and leg, and he clears his front leg and hits through the line with a perfectly straight bat, extending his arms high over his head, and clears the straight boundary
full on middle and off, driven down to long-on, slightly uppish but well wide of the bowler
walks across towards off stump even before Prasad has gotten into his delivery stride, and the bowler reacts well by firing in the yorker on middle stump. Jabbed back to the bowler
full outside off, and that is lovely. Leans forward and punches it with a straight bat, between short cover and mid-off, and neither fielder moved an inch.
tossed up wide outside off and he's quickly down the pitch to drive to deep cover
full and flat on off stump, and he gets forward to lap-sweep to short fine leg
down the track now, and that is brilliant placement. Stays inside the line and drills that inside-out between short cover and a diving mid-off, beating them both
length ball on off stump, and he drives it down to long-on to bring up his fifth ODI half-century
down the track again, for the old checked drive to long-off for the strolled single. The lifeline of ODI batting against spin
tossed up outside off, defended with the turn to short midwicket
and there's the reverse-sweep again, paddled away to the right of short third man, who puts in the dive to stop that from costing his team more runs
full outside leg, clipped to short midwicket
down the track now, clipped to the man at deep forward square leg

gone. Dhawan goes for the slog-sweep, doesn't quite pick the right ball for it. It isn't as full as he wants it, and it bounces up and takes his edge, and he pops a simple catch to Priyanjan at deep square leg
tossed up on leg stump, driven down the ground but Seekuge dives across to his right to stop that
back of a length now and he goes deep in his crease to punch that to long-on
length ball angling in towards leg stump, blocked towards short midwicket
short, wide, and he's up on his toes to crash that away between backward point and third man. Top shot
full on middle stump, clipped down to long-on
full on off stump, whipped down to mid-on to get off the strike in typical Kohli fashion
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
full outside off, angling in, driven towards short midwicket. Went off the inside half of his bat. He was looking to hit that straighter, I think.
down the track, driven down to long-off
tossed up towards middle stump, blocked off the front foot
back of a length on middle and leg, punched down to long-on
down the track, stays inside the line of the ball, and he drives it sweetly, inside-out, to his favourite cover boundary, hits it to the left of the short cover fielder and long-off has no chance
on the pads now, tucked away to the left of short fine leg
tossed up outside off, and he's down the track to play a nice checked drive to the left of mid-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump, blocked to short cover
length ball on off stump, and it swung away late as Rayudu tried to steer it to third man, beat his outside edge and swung even more as it approached Sanga's gloves

length ball, comes in towards the top of off, and he pushes it almost straight to short cover and takes off for the single. Virat dives in, and I think he'd have just been in even if Randiv's underarm flick had hit the stumps
bouncer now, outside off. Kohli leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
full-toss wide outside off, and that's slapped away to the left of the man at deep cover
goes back to the length ball on leg stump, worked it away wide of midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, worked away off the back foot towards square leg
tossed up wide outside off, flat-batted to sweeper cover
shortish ball on off stump, rocks back but can't beat point with his cut
tossed up now and he comes down the track to drive inside-out to cover
short again, that sat up, and he slaps it hard but can't beat cover
shortish ball, and he rocks back to pull that to deep midwicket
goes back to the length ball outside off, works it away to the right of deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, and he blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and tucks it away wide of short midwicket
down the track now, clipped away to the right of short midwicket
down the track now and he shifts his line straighter. He immediately drops to one knee and sweeps it away to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, slapped to point
again a bit of width outside off and this time his cut finds the gap to the left of point
shuffles across to this length ball on off and middle and works it away towards deep square leg
short now, and Virat swivels on his back foot to pull that away to deep backward square leg
short again, sat up this time, pulled towards deep square leg with his front leg in the air
short and wide and it's slapped down to third man
goes on the back foot to the length ball on off stump, and clips it away to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump. He makes a bit of room and dabs it down to short third man
gets nicely forward to this tossed-up ball on middle stump and turns his wrists on it to place it to the left of short fine leg
down the track again, and Randiv shortens his length. Rayudu works it to short midwicket
down the leg side now, and Rayudu punishes him, sweeping nice and fine, between the keeper and short fine leg
swept away again, from leg stump. Squarer this time, down to deep square leg
short ball, angling down leg, and he pulls it away to the fine leg boundary. Was a little late on the shot, but that kind of helped him with that fortuitous bit of placement.
back of a length outside off, and that's a lovely shot, got on top of that to punch it behind point, and Kusal does very well to sprint to his right from third man and dive to stop the boundary
short ball, and he had to drag that pull from wide outside off, over shoulder height, but he connects so well that he clears the midwicket boundary comfortably. Wide long-on, in fact.
full-toss on off stump, punched down to long-on
fullish outside off, and he leans into a solid drive, straight to short cover
waist-high full-toss on middle stump, tucked away towards short midwicket
full-toss outside off, driven to deep cover
goes on the back foot to a flattish length ball on leg stump, tucks it away towards deep square leg to move into the 90s
back of a length and he rocks back to pull that to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, and he comes down the track, doesn't reach the pitch, and blocks into the covers
back of a length down the leg side, worked off the hips towards deep square leg
down the track again, and this time he's right to the pitch of it to launch it back over the bowler's head. That's his fourth six, and he's on 98 now
length ball, turns in from off to middle, he lets it come on and defends back to the bowler
back of a length on middle, and he shuffles across to work it into the on side
length ball, angles it in towards leg stump. He tucks it away towards square leg and hurries off, hoping he can take a second, and Virat calmly, wisely, stops him at one.
full on off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball angling into the pads, clipped away towards deep square leg
length ball, angling in towards off, tucking him up for room. He blocks it back to the bowler
doesn't arrive just yet. It's full on off and he pushes it to mid-off, a touch too firmly for the single
back of a length on off stump, steps back and across to tuck it down to short midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, clipped away towards square leg

and there it is. It's back of a length on the stumps, and he goes back and across and clips it away to the right of square leg. Off goes the helmet, and on comes a big smile. Fairly understated celebration
down the track now, and that's a Kohli special. Stays inside the line, and twists his wrists to launch that over the extra cover boundary
short now, rising to head-height, and he pulls it down with a turn of his wrists to deep backward square leg
short again, and this is nicely pulled by Rayudu, extending his arms and rolling his wrists over to keep it down to the right of deep midwicket
full on leg stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
not that short and Kohli misread the length, going back to cut. It turned away and took a thick outside edge past the keeper, no slip in place of course
back of a length now and he slaps it to the man at cover
tossed up now, outside off, and he's down the track and he drills that down the ground with a huge amount of bottom-hand, past the stumps and long-on has no chance
full and flat and he blocks it off the front foot
short, wide, cracked away to sweeper cover
back of a length and he goes deep in his crease and tucks it away into the leg side
back of a length again, worked from outside off towards square leg
tossed up outside off and he leans across to lap-sweep that to long leg
tossed up on off stump, comes forward to clip it to short midwicket
tossed up again, and this time he gets on one knee and sweeps it in the air from outside off, into the gap at deep square leg
down the track now, pushed to the right of the bowler, who makes a good diving stop
short, and you don't bowl there to Kohli. He's back in a flash and he swats that violently over the deep midwicket boundary
tossed up outside off now, and Kohli takes the strolled single after driving to sweeper cover
down the track now, blocked to short cover after he realised he hadn't reached the pitch of the ball
down the track again, dips down shorter than he expected, and he clips it away to short midwicket
and now he gets close to the pitch of the ball and drives to long-off
shortish outside off, doesn't quite get up, and he chops it to short cover
tossed up outside off and he lets it come on and opens his bat face to find the gap to the left of short cover
back of a length, turning down leg. Kohli goes deep in his crease to tuck that away to square leg
back of a length again, punched to short midwicket off the back foot
tossed up on leg stump, and Kohli sweeps to deep backward square leg

down the track now, mid-off is in the circle, and he steps inside the line to launch it over that fielder, one bounce into the boundary. Didn't time it as well as he would have liked but the placement was spot-on
down the track again, and this time he clips it down to long-on
back of a length, turning in towards off stump, pushed into the covers off the back foot
length ball wide outside off. He waits on it and dabs it to short third man
short, wide, slapped away to the left of the man at sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, poked away to deep cover
got him! That was nicely flighted outside off and Kohli came forward to drive. Dipped on him a bit and he hit it uppishly, and Randiv took a lovely low catch, diving forward
down the track first ball, clips it with the turn to deep midwicket
down the track again, and bang, that's launched cleanly over mid-off

down the track again, and this time he isn't as close to the pitch of the ball as the previous one. That's not a bad thing at all, since Raina has even more room to swing his arms and find even more elevation, smashes that over the sightscreen
tossed up outside leg. Raina looks for the lap-sweep, misses, is hit on the front pad
angles this in towards leg stump and he shuffles across to tuck it away to deep backward square leg
drops onto a good length on off stump and he comes forward to block it back to the bowler
down the track now, punched back to the bowler

gone! That was an ambitious, slightly casual shot, trying to sweep a very full ball from the stumps. Hit his front pad almost on the half-volley, in front of middle and off, and the umpire has a bit of a think before raising his finger
turns down the leg side and he tucks it off his hips towards short fine leg. Jadeja is slightly late off the blocks but takes the single fairly comfortably
down the track, inside-out over the cover fielder, and that is that. India have strolled to the easiest win possible
